website_summaries.verdict: This double-handle ski rope is good for helping you keep control on one ski.
pros: Soft handles that are easy to grip
Double handle helps you keep control and balance while skiing slalom
Bright colors make it easy to spot in the water
cons: The double handle will provide a different feel for balance when you're getting up and during your ride
It may be more challenging for beginner skiers

customer_reviews.title: Sink
customer_reviews.text: The price was fair! But the handles sink in the water. Going to have to put some styrofoam or something so that the handles don't sink!! Thought of returning, but have already tried them! They work, but you would think the handles would at least float!! Disapponted.
customer_reviews.author: Delwin M.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for price no benefit to 2 handles vs 1 handle rope
customer_reviews.text: We had a single handle ski rope and I was told a double would make it easier for my son to learn to ski. Not true in my opinion after buying only reason I gave it only 3 stars is it costs more than a single handle that will do the same thing
customer_reviews.author: Clayton A. Tomlinson

customer_reviews.title: Hard to find the handles in the water
customer_reviews.text: The handles don't float. I added a 3"x5" red float to the handle end of the rope. The hand grips are very comfortable for both small and large hands.
customer_reviews.author: Button Watkins

customer_reviews.title: Love this for slalom skiing!
customer_reviews.text: Great tow rope for skiing, especially slalom. Only downside is the non floating handles, but you can fix that with a styrofoam. Don't understand why there aren't more out there.
customer_reviews.author: Lori Rice

customer_reviews.title: Works ok
customer_reviews.text: Bought this handle for my wife, this is her second year of water skiing ever so she's fairly new. She can get up on slalom now but she struggled for a little while and she thought it would be easier for her if she could have a handle on each side of the ski. Didn't help but that ok. I'd recommend getting a handle with the slot in front of the handle to help keep the rope straight if your learning. Only complaint is the handles do not float very good. I always put a kwik tek floating ball on all my ropes, but the handles sink pretty fast
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Let's Get Back to the Double Handle Rope to Teach Water Skiing Again
customer_reviews.text: Best double handle ski rope ever. Generous bridle for single-ski deep water starts. Handle ends are cushioned to protect skis from getting dings and protecting the handles and skier.
customer_reviews.author: R-Max

customer_reviews.title: so so. deducted a star because the black portion ...
customer_reviews.text: so so. deducted a star because the black portion of each handle is much smaller than even a small hand. Very large hands would likely be edge to edge.
customer_reviews.author: RedBaron057

customer_reviews.title: Sub-par product
customer_reviews.text: Both the original order and the replacement came with cut strands. VERY DANGEROUS! Seems like the supplier is trying to unload defective product.
customer_reviews.author: SimiEd

customer_reviews.title: Not a bad rope. Taking off two stars because the handles ...
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad rope. Taking off two stars because the handles don't float which means you have to be more cautious about get the rope tangled up in your prop.
customer_reviews.author: L. Marti

customer_reviews.title: Ski rope sinks
customer_reviews.text: This ski rope is not recommended. Love the idea of a double handled rope for single skiis. However the handles sink almost instantly so unless you get ahold of it right away you will be swimming with your ski on or your spotter will have to reel it in and rethrow. We were shocked that it wouldn't have been made to float. The company, however, was more that willing to take it back and send a new one. Hopefully we find one that floats.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonMom

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: excellent quality, and worked great for learning to get up on one ski
customer_reviews.author: Mel

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for Double Handled ski rope
customer_reviews.text: Good quality rope. Very hard to find a double handle rope anymore and this one works well. Handles have good grips and are easy to hold. Would buy again/recommend.
customer_reviews.author: like2read

customer_reviews.title: excellent
customer_reviews.text: Very good quality rope for skiing. would buy it again if needed
customer_reviews.author: S. Black

customer_reviews.title: Double Handled Ski Rope
customer_reviews.text: This is a 'Christmas' gift for my daughter in CO .. They cannot get these double handled ski ropes there.. Judging by the rope, it looks like it is good quality and I believe my daughter will enjoy this... Won't know until next summer tho!!
customer_reviews.author: K. D. Reilman

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Will return handles are very hard and hurt hands so much I cant use them
customer_reviews.author: Cherell Holladay

customer_reviews.title: Great 2 handle rope!
customer_reviews.text: This 2 handle rope is great. The handles are good for your hands and help keep the grip tight. It is very hard to find this type of rope in any other store, and the price is just right!
customer_reviews.author: L. Hilbert

customer_reviews.title: Great double handled rope
customer_reviews.text: Great double handled rope! Rope floats very well and is easy to see. Handles do not float on top of the water but easy to find in the water, just below the surface. Good grip. Only used last weekend so don't know about longevity but happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle150

customer_reviews.title: Very well made product
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I wanted to get. Our other double handle ski rope needed to be replaced, and this one is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Nancy G

customer_reviews.title: Well made product
customer_reviews.text: It's difficult to find a double handle ski rope, but this one is sturdy, well made, and has comfortable handles. I recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: California Girl

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Water Ski Rope!!
customer_reviews.text: This rope is great for single handle water skiing. Super buoyant and a super comfortable grip. Very satisfied and I highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: the handles sink
customer_reviews.text: The handles on this rope sink making it harder to retrieve when you are in the water trying to grab the rope. I found the grip hard on my hands, it left indentation marks on my palms. I didn't use ski gloves.
customer_reviews.author: Jean C

customer_reviews.title: Only if the Skier could get up lol works great so far
customer_reviews.text: Only if the Skier could get up lol works great so far, can drag a person across the water pretty good.
customer_reviews.author: Brian young

customer_reviews.title: Two Stars
customer_reviews.text: The handles were hard to hold on to. They were slick
customer_reviews.author: Debbie

customer_reviews.title: Handles sink.
customer_reviews.text: First time I used these the handles sank like a rock. Very surprising. Never seen ski handles do this. Don't know how the skier could ever find the end of the rope. Pulled the rope back in. Too late to return
customer_reviews.author: RAK

customer_reviews.title: Did not work to learn to slalom ski
customer_reviews.text: I bought this after reading about how a two handled ski rope might make learning to do a deep water start on a slalom ski easier. It did not work for me. After trying to get up for 1/2 hour or so I discovered that the ski I used was to long to clear the V between the two handles as was the plan. This rope may work for someone who does not use such a long ski. As a regular ski rope it is fine as long as you want two handles.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M. Brennan

customer_reviews.title: Worked good
customer_reviews.text: It needs a float at handle, it sinks. Worked good
customer_reviews.author: Eddie Woestman

customer_reviews.title: Helpful tool for water skiing
customer_reviews.text: Just what I was looking for to help my grandson learn to slalom ski, helps to guide the tip of the ski
customer_reviews.author: M. Watts

customer_reviews.title: Like it a lot
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for salom training to get up. Keeps the ski straight when you put it between the handles Didn't know they still made these
customer_reviews.author: Mark Perry

customer_reviews.title: dual handle
customer_reviews.text: My wife was used to dual handle ropes as that's primarily what is used in Australia. Dual handles appear to be difficult to find in the US as this was the only pair I could locate. Functionally, these are much better than straight handles once you see how to use them.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Shaffer

product_meta.title: AIRHEAD Ski Rope, Double Handle
feature_bullets: TPR tractor grips and 4" finger guards
The product has a Double handle

specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
specifications.International Shipping: This item can be shipped to select countries outside of the U.S.
